description: ST looks at how the weapon, which is usually non-lethal, works and what could make them ineffective. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Bendemeer police shooting: How Tasers work and why they sometimes fail to subdue subjects
title_page: Bendemeer police shooting: How Tasers work and why they sometimes fail to subdue subjects | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE - A 64-year-old man wielding a knife continued to advance towards police officers despite the officers firing three Taser shots at him at Block 33 Bendemeer Road on Wednesday (March 23).
As the officers sensed an imminent threat to their safety, one of them shot Ng Eng Kui in the chest with his pistol.
